title._content: [Turtle Bay Gardens, 227-47 East 48 Street and 242-46 East 49 Street, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Turtle Bay Gardens, 227-47 East 48 Street and 242-46 East 49 Street, New York, New York. View to fountain between west loggias] [1920 Fall] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture and landscape: Edward Clarence Dean and William Lawrence Bottomley, 1919-1920. Associated Name: Charlotte Bronson Hunnewell Sorchan, developer. Today: Extant. On slide: Blue star sticker. On slide (printed), partially obscured by blank label: "T [...] c." (Slide manufactured by: T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., 176 Fulton St., New York) Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16675 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 31
